properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Pioneer Bay, St Helier, The Gurdies, Grantville, Woodleigh
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Grantville, Pioneer Bay, St Helier, The Gurdies, Woodleigh.

  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 4.59pm on 21st December 2024.
  • There is a bushfire at The Gurdies Nature Conservation Reserve that is not yet under control.
  • Firefighters are still working to create control lines around the fire and to extinguish any hot spots.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Emergency services will remain in the area. 
  • Bulldozers and aircraft are operating in the area.
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 23/12/2024 05:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Jallukar, Londonderry, Moyston, Rhymney, Willaura North, Bellellen, Black Range, Great Western, Lake Fyans, Pomonal, Willaura
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Bellellen, Black Range, Great Western, Jallukar, Lake Fyans, Londonderry, Moyston, Pomonal, Rhymney, Willaura, Willaura North. 

  • This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act - Prepare to Leave issued at 4:26pm today.
  • It is strongly recommended you Prepare to Leave. 
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd. The bushfire is not yet under control.
  • The fire is travelling in a north easterly direction and is now spotting into areas between Spears Rd and College Rd.
Prepare to Leave immediately. Leave as soon as you are ready, as roads will become busy as people leave.
What you should do:
  • Monitor the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can mean the situation is worsening.
  • Protect yourself and your family.
  • If you are not prepared, leave now. Donâ€™t wait until it is too late - leave early. 
  • If you are away from home, do not return.
If you are leaving, pack: 
  • Cash 
  • Clothing for three days 
  • Medicine for three days 
  • Phone and chargers 
  • Toiletries 
  • Important documents 
  • Meaningful items and photos 
  • Pet essentials, including leash and carriers.
Check on your neighbours if it is safe.

Check the VicTraffic website for road closures.

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 

Where to go:
  • Friends or family away from the fire. 
  • Consider roads may become busy closer to the time of impact. 
Relief Centres Now Open: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 23/12/2024 01:20 am or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page.

Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Bullengarook, Gisborne, Macedon, Mount Macedon, New Gisborne, Woodend. 

  • There is a bushfire at Bullengarook that is not yet under control.
  • Firefighters are working to build containment lines. 
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 
  • This Community Information replaces the Advice Message issued on Saturday 21/12 at 7:27pm
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 23/12/2024 05:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).

properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for Licola, Licola North. 

  • There is a bushfire at 25Km Nw Of Licola that is contained.
  • Firefighters are working to fully extinguish this fire.
  • The Barkley Bridge Campground is currently closed.
  • Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads.
  • Emergency services vehicles will be in the Glencairn Road area.
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.

The next update is expected by 23/12/2024 05:30 pm or as the situation changes.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Bullengarook.

  • There is a bushfire at Bullengarook that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling from Coffeys Road in a north-easterly direction towards Mulcahy Road and Waterloo Flat Road.
  • Crews have been able to slow the spread of fire for now, but the situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
  • This Watch & Act Message replaces the Watch & Act issued at 8:46am today.
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
  • Find information on protecting yourself and your family: www.cfa.vic.gov.au/plan-prepare/before-and-during-a-fire
Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 

Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger.  
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area.
Impacts in your area:
Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous. 
The following roads are closed: Coffeys Road and Waterloo Flat Road.
Numerous tracks within the Wombat State Forest are closed.
This includes Finger Post Road and a number of adjoining tracks.
Check the VicTraffic Website or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

The next update is expected by 23/12/2024 09:30 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.location: Cabbage Tree, Dean, Wattle Flat, Chapel Flat, Clarkes Hill, Glen Park, Springmount
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Cabbage Tree, Chapel Flat, Clarkes Hill, Dean, Glen Park, Springmount, Wattle Flat.

  • There is a bushfire at Melbourne Rd, Creswick that is contained.
  • Smoke may still be visible to surrounding communities.  
  • Crews and aircraft will continue to work in the area. 
  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 1pm, Saturday 21 December 2024.
You should stay informed, monitor conditions and stay away from the area.
What you should do: 
  • To help ensure the safety of our emergency personnel, do not fly drones over the fire area. 
  • Slow down to a speed that enables you to stop safely when you see emergency services working beside the road. 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Firefighting vehicles and machinery will be moving around in the area.
Road closures
All roads are now open. 
40km per hour speed restrictions are in place for the following roads:
  • Creswick-Dean Road between Melbourne Road and Skilbecks Road
  • Melbourne Road between Creswick-Dean Road and Russells Reservoir.   
Forest Tracks
Internal forest tracks in the fire area remain closed including Bush Inn Road.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 23/12/2024 01:40 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Grampians Junction, Halls Gap, Fyans Creek
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Bellfield, Bellfield Settlement, Flat Rock Crossing, Fyans Creek, Grampians Junction, Halls Gap.
 
  •  It is Not Safe to Return to Halls Gap 
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in a northerly direction which has reached Lake Bellfield and the Major Mitchell Plateau.
  • Back burning operations will be conducted today and smoke will be visible
  • This Watch and Act message replaces the emergency warning issued at 5.48pm on Saturday 21 December 2024.
It is Not Safe to Return. 
What you should do:

If you have not already left: 
  • Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards.
  • Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance.
If you have already left: 
  • Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued.
  • Relief centres are open at Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat and the Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell..
  • Register at a relief centre so your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe.
  • Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings.
Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page.
Impacts in your area:
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 22/12/2024 08:00 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
  • The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. To access this information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline. 
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

It is Not Safe to Return. What you should do: If you have not already left: - Stay where you are and avoid dangerous bushfire and tree hazards. - Check you have enough food, drinking water and medications - if you do not, phone Triple Zero (000) for assistance. If you have already left: - Do not return to your home until a Safe to Return notification is issued. - Relief centres are open at Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat and the Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell.. - Register at a relief centre so your friends, family and authorities can be informed that you are safe. - Stay informed by listening to emergency broadcasters and monitoring warnings. Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.location: Jimmy Creek, Mirranatwa, Bornes Hill, Grampians, Victoria Valley
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Bornes Hill, Grampians, Jimmy Creek, Mirranatwa, Victoria Valley. 

  • This Watch and Act message replaces the Watch and Act issued at 1.27pm, Saturday 21/12/2024.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road. The bushfire is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in a north-easterly direction 
  • Increased fire activity on the eastern side of the fire near Mafeking is producing larger quantities of smoke.
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Relief Centres Now Open: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell.
Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area 
Impacts in your area:
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 23/12/2024 12:00 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Wartook, Zumsteins.

  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 5:13pm Saturday 21/12/24.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in a northerly direction which has reached Lake Bellfield and the Major Mitchell Plateau. 
  • Back burning operations are continuing today which will include both aerial and ground ignition. Smoke will be visible.
Relief Centres Now Open: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell.
Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page.
There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
Impacts in your area: 
Smoke may be visible from nearby communities and roads. 

Road Closures:
Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

Grampians National Park Visitor Information:
The Grampians National Park is closed to visitors. For further details please visit the website: Parks Victoria - Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 23/12/2024 10:00 am or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.action: Monitor Conditions As They Are Changing
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Lake Fyans, Pomonal

  • This Watch and Act replaces the Watch and Act - Prepare to Leave issued at 5.30pm on Saturday 21 Dec ember 2024.
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap road that is not yet under control.  
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in a northerly direction which has reached Lake Bellfield and the Major Mitchell Plateau. 
  • Back burning operations will continue today utilising both aerial and ground ignition and smoke will be visible.
The situation can change at any time. You must monitor conditions and be ready to act.
What you should do: 
  • Monitor changes to the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can indicate the situation is changing. 
  • Enact your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes. 
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions. 
  • Protect yourself and your family.
Relief Centres Now Open: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell.
Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page.

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 
Remember to:
  • Take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger. 
  • Many people have died trying to leave at the last minute during fires. 
  • Travel to the home of family or friends that are away from the warning area

Impacts in your area:
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.
This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 22/12/2024 07:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Community Information
properties.webBody:
This Community Information message is being issued for smoke at Boolarra, Boolarra South.

  • You will see or smell smoke across parts of Boolarra and Boolarra South. 
  • Smoke is a result of a fire at Barktown Road, Boolarra South
  • Firefighters are monitoring this fire. 
There is no immediate threat to the community and no action is required.
What you should do:

  • Your nose is an excellent smoke detector. If you can smell smoke, take the necessary precautions to protect your health. You can self-assess the air quality near you using https://www.epa.vic.gov.au/for-community/environmental-information/air-quality/smoke/smoke-your-health.
Take action to reduce your exposure to smoke and protect your health: 
  • Everyone should minimise the time spent in smoky conditions whenever practical to do so.
  • People over 65 years, children 14 years and younger, pregnant women and those with existing heart or lung conditions, should reduce prolonged or heavy physical activity. Where possible (and not under direct threat from fires), also limit the time spent outdoors and when indoors, close windows and doors. If there is a break in smoky conditions, open the windows and air out your home.
  • Anyone with a heart or lung condition should take their medication as prescribed. People with asthma should follow their personal asthma action plan, continue to take preventer medication as prescribed and keep reliever medication on hand.
  • If you or anyone in your care is worried about symptoms, seek medical advice or call Nurse on Call on 1300 60 60 24.
  • Anyone experiencing difficulty breathing or tightness in the chest should seek urgent medical assistance and call Triple Zero (000).
This message was issued by Country Fire Authority.

Unless the situation changes, this will be the last smoke message issued.

Use multiple sources to stay informed:
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.  
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Emergency Warning
properties.webBody:
This Emergency Warning is being issued for Barton, Mafeking, Moyston, Watgania. 

This Emergency Warning replaces the Emergency Warning issued at 3.45pm today due to a change in fire behaviour. 

  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
  • The fire is travelling in a north east direction and is now spotting into areas between Spears Rd and College Rd
  • The bushfire could impact Mafeking, Watgania and areas west of the Moyston township in the next two hours. 
Leaving immediately is the safest option, before conditions become too dangerous. 

Emergency services may not be able to help you if you decide to stay.
What you should do: 

Travel to: 
  • The home of family or friends that is away from the warning area.
  • You should leave using the Dunkeld-Moyston Road and head towards Ararat or Stawell. 
  • When you leave remember to take your pets, medications, mobile phone and charger.

Relief Centers are open at: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell.

In the car: 
  • If you are travelling, do not enter the area. Make a u-turn and travel to safety.
  • Slow down and turn on your headlights. Smoke will make it difficult to see.

If you are unable to leave you should shelter indoors:
  • Close all exterior doors, windows and vents. Turn off cooling systems.
  • You must take shelter before the fire arrives. The extreme heat is likely to kill you well before the flames reach you.
  • Shelter in a room that has two exits, such as a door or window including one directly to the outside. It is important to be able to see outside so you know what is happening with the fire. 
  • If your home catches on fire and the conditions inside become unbearable, you need to get out and go to an area that has already been burnt. 

If you cannot get indoors, other last resort options include:
  • Shelter in the middle of a large open area like a ploughed paddock, football oval or sporting reserve.
  • Get into a large body of water like a dam, lake, river, the ocean or inground pool.
  • Try to protect yourself from the fire's heat.

If you are caught in fire in your car:
  • Park behind a solid structure to block the fire's heat or pull over to cleared area.
  • Try to position the car towards the approaching fire.
  • Turn on your hazard lights and headlights.
  • Close all windows.
  • Turn off the air-conditioning and shut all the air vents.
  • Turn your car engine off.
  • Get down as low as possible below window level and cover up with a pure woollen blanket.
Impacts in your area: 
  • For road closures check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70.
Grampians National Park visitor information: 
The Grampians National Park is closed.
This messages was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 22/12/2024 10:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226.
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#vicfires).
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Watch & Act
properties.location: Fyans Creek, Lake Lonsdale, Mokepilly, Mount Dryden, Ledcourt
properties.webBody:
This Watch and Act message is being issued for Fyans Creek, Lake Lonsdale, Ledcourt, Mokepilly, Mount Dryden. 
  • It is strongly recommended you Prepare to Leave. 
  • There is a bushfire at Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Rd. The bushfire is not yet under control.
  • The bushfire is travelling from Glenelg River Rd in a north-easterly direction  

Prepare to Leave immediately. Leave as soon as you are ready, as roads will become busy as people leave.
What you should do:
  • Monitor the situation. Increased wind speed, change in wind direction, smoke or poor visibility can mean the situation is worsening.
  • Protect yourself and your family.
  • If you are not prepared, leave now. Donâ€™t wait until it is too late - leave early. 
  • If you are away from home, do not return.
If you are leaving, pack: 
  • Cash 
  • Clothing for three days 
  • Medicine for three days 
  • Phone and chargers 
  • Toiletries 
  • Important documents 
  • Meaningful items and photos 
  • Pet essentials, including leash and carriers.
Check on your neighbours if it is safe.

Check the VicTraffic website for road closures.

Leave if the situation changes or you feel unsafe. 

Where to go:
  • Friends or family away from the fire. 
  • Consider roads may become busy closer to the time of impact. 

Relief Centres Now Open: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria. 

The next update is expected by 22/12/2024 10:00 pm or as the situation changes. 

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au 
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226 
  • VicEmergency app 
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires) 
  • ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV. 
Accessibility: 
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency. 
  • For information in other languages, call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.   
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.

properties.name: Advice
properties.webBody:
This Advice message is being issued for Kia Ora, Willaura.


  • This Advice replaces the Advice issued at 1.55pm on Saturday 21/12/2024.
  • There is a bushfire in the Grampians National Park - Yarram Gap Road that is not yet under control. 
  • The bushfire is travelling from Grampians National Park in a northerly easterly direction from the Major Mitchell Plateau. 
Relief Centres Now Open: 
  • Alexandra Oval Community Centre 1 Waratah Ave, Ararat. 
  • Grampians Community Health, known as "The Shacc", 22 Patrick Street Stawell.

Recordings of Community Meetings are available from the VicEmergency - Grampians Facebook Page.

There is currently no threat to you, but you should stay informed and plan for what you will do if the situation changes. 
What you should do: 
  • Monitor weather conditions and warnings. 
  • Review your fire survival plan. 
  • If you do not have a plan, decide what you will do if the situation changes.
  • If you have time, check your neighbours to see if they are monitoring conditions.
Impacts in your area: 
  • Smoke will visible from nearby communities and roads
  • Bushfires can spread quickly and are extremely dangerous.
  • Trees can be extremely dangerous during a bushfire or high winds. Do not stand, park or travel in areas of fire affected trees.
 
Road Closures:
Check the VicTraffic website (traffic.vicroads.vic.gov.au/) or call 13 11 70 for road closures.

Grampians National Park Visitor Information:
The Grampians National Park is closed to visitors. For further details please visit the website: Parks Victoria - Grampians (Gariwerd) National Park 

This message was issued by Forest Fire Management Victoria.

The next update is expected by 23/12/2024 01:30 pm or as the situation changes.

Use multiple sources to stay informed: 
  • www.emergency.vic.gov.au
  • VicEmergency Hotline - freecall 1800 226 226
  • VicEmergency app
  • Facebook or Twitter (#VicFires)
  • Tune in to ABC Local Radio, commercial and designated community radio stations, or Sky News TV.
Accessibility:
The following services can help you, or someone you know, access information during an emergency.
  • To access this information in other languages call the Translating and Interpreting Service on 131 450 (freecall) and ask them to call VicEmergency Hotline.
  • If you are deaf, hard of hearing, or have a speech/communication impairment contact National Relay Service on 1800 555 677 and ask them to call the VicEmergency Hotline.
